ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Overall an interesting seminar. I learned a lot about ritual and status in South Asian religions, as well as how senses work.

I learned a great deal about the senses and how the senses are connected both internally and externally. I also learned how to contemplate a concept which is inexplicable: Brahman. The course gave me a new appreciation of South Asian cultures, and overall helped change my academic path throughout college.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There should have been many fewer readings, much less powerpoint time, and a better split between undergrad and grad students. A lot of the airtime was taken up with grad students in an imbalanced way.

I love the structure (weekly papers on the readings, then discussion in class) because we had to consistently engage with the material and couldn't skip the readings. That being said, I could have used an introduction to Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism at the beginning of the class so that I understood the context.
Professor Gerety's experience in the field and the fact that students were not only undergraduates but graduate students as well as faculty guests.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a great course. If you keep up on the work, it isn't stressful at all and the topics of discussion are interesting. There is a lot of reading/watching/looking at/listening to other media, but it isn't a ridiculous amount.

Yes, definitely. The course was taught very well and in an engaging manner. It was a truly unique classroom experience, as I was able to learn not only from the instructor but other students of various backgrounds. It was a very intellectually and spiritually stimulating environment.
